creator: y-iida@secom.co.jp
text:
Adding access="private" attribute to <javadoc> tasks barfs:
[javadoc] javadoc: error - More than one of -public, -private, -package, or -protected specified.

Adding Private="Private" exits normally, but it does not seem to be working.

Running ``ant -version'' reads:
Apache Ant(TM) version 1.8.2 compiled on December 20 2010

I tried with the following java version:
 * java version "1.6.0_27"
   Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_27-b07)
   Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 20.2-b06, mixed mode, sharing)
 * java version "1.7.0"
   Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0-b147)
   Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 21.0-b17, mixed mode)

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
Can you give the full <javadoc> tag for the case where access="private" doesn't work?

For your second attempt: private is a boolean attribute and anything that is not a "truth" value understood by Ant means "false".  Try private="true".

creator: y-iida@secom.co.jp
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Can you give the full <javadoc> tag for the case where access="private" doesn't
> work?

I tried the following:
<javadoc access="private"
         classpath="${class.path}" destdir="${javadoc.dest.dir}"
         encoding="${src.encoding}" failonerror="true" Package="yes"
         sourcepath="${javadoc.source.path}" />

<javadoc private="yes"
         classpath="${class.path}" destdir="${javadoc.dest.dir}"
         encoding="${src.encoding}" failonerror="true" Package="yes"
         sourcepath="${javadoc.source.path}" />

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: You have two attributes that control access, access and package.  If you remove package="yes" things are going to work.

creator: y-iida@secom.co.jp
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> You have two attributes that control access, access and package.  If you remove
> package="yes" things are going to work.

The followings worked:
<javadoc access="private"
         classpath="${class.path}" destdir="${javadoc.dest.dir}"
         encoding="${src.encoding}" failonerror="true"
         sourcepath="${javadoc.source.path}" />

Please close the case.
Thank you and sorry for taking your time.
